pr_title: [ML] Delete dest index and reindex if incompatible

timeline.message:
[ML] Delete dest index and reindex if incompatible

Data frame analytics results format changed in version `7.10.0`.
If existing jobs that were not completed are restarted, it is
possible the destination index had already been created. That index's
mappings are not suitable for the new results format.

This commit checks the version of the destination index and deletes
it when the version is outdated. The job will then continue by
recreating the destination index and reindexing.

timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText:
I think it was originally added not realizing version was already available.
Thinking about it though, I wonder if there is a benefit reading the version from _meta. Unlike the index settings, we can overwrite _meta. That would leave an open option if in the feature we had to manually upgrade an index and tag it so by updating the version in _meta. Does that make sense or am I just sugar coating it? :-)
replies.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText:
That would leave an open option if in the feature we had to manually upgrade an index and tag it so by updating the version in _meta.

This is what we do with most ML indices.  The version in _meta refers not to the version the index was created in, but to the version that the mappings were last updated in.  So there's definitely a benefit in us storing a version that's not constrained to be the same as the creation version.  But in this case the field that stores the version is called created.  It's really a schema version that we want.

replies.bodyText: Right, agreed, the fact that the version is keys as created is not ideal. We could change this though it'll come with some BWC code.
